abstract:
We study root separation for reducible monic integer polynomials
of degree four. If H(P) is the height and sep(P) the minimal distance
between two distinct roots of a separable integer polynomial P(x), and
sep(P) = H(P)^(-e(P)), we show that lim sup e(P) = 2, where limsup is
taken over all reducible monic integer polynomials P(x) of degree 4.
